title: Mmr keeps dropping, even after big winstreaks..
body: The problem is: I got to diamond V, but when I got there, I got a like 10 games losestreak, so stopped playing ranked. I didnt play for a long time, but eventually started playing ranked again. I went on a huge winning streak, but it has become impossible to get my mmr back up. I started at 2120mmr (calculated on OP.GG) and after that I went on a 10 games win streak. my mmr didnt rise on that at all. I got +7s,+8s +9s. When I lose I get -31LP (all losses! -31) with a huge mmr drop each time. I kept my winrate high and I have like 75% winrate over the last 20 games, but my mmr just keeps dropping. I am now at 2010mmr. I started at 2120mmr. Why am I getting lower mmr even though I get a +-80% winrate? I don't get it. It makes it literally impossible to climb. I don't wanna blame the system, but I want an explaination about what I can do to improve my mmr. Even by winning it drops, so I got scared of playing ranked. Thanks for reading and hoping on good help :) Greets NY Crispy

replies.body:
>calculated on OP.GG

well there's your problem.

You didn't link your main, so I can only suggest you got boosted.

Don't get boosted, and then complain that you can't stay at a rank you don't deserve.
This is the reason that I havent played many games after I hit d5. Just wait a bit for the season to reset and the mmr should balance out again.
If you didn't know Master tier dropped the MMR of every player by quite a bit when they added it so if you quit before it was around then that's most likely the cause.

lolking is a more accurate measure of your mmr

the only way to fix it is by playing more games

generally though, +20lp for win -15-20lp for loss is average mmr

25+lp for win -10-15lp for loss is extremely good

less than 20lp for win losing more than 20lp on loss is below average mmr
